title: A Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Framework for Off-Policy Evaluation in Two-sided Markets. (arXiv:2202.10574v4 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: The two-sided markets such as ride-sharing companies often involve a group of subjects who are making sequential decisions across time and/or location. With the rapid development of smart phones and internet of things, they have substantially transformed the transportation landscape of human beings. In this paper we consider large-scale fleet management in ride-sharing companies that involve multiple units in different areas receiving sequences of products (or treatments) over time. Major technical challenges, such as policy evaluation, arise in those studies because (i) spatial and temporal proximities induce interference between locations and times; and (ii) the large number of locations results in the curse of dimensionality. To address both challenges simultaneously, we introduce a multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) framework for carrying policy evaluation in these studies. We propose novel estimators for mean outcomes under different products that are consistent despite the

Title: A Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Framework for Off-Policy Evaluation in Two-sided Markets. (arXiv:2202.10574v4 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
Abstract: The two-sided markets such as ride-sharing companies often involve a group of subjects who are making sequential decisions across time and/or location. With the rapid development of smart phones and internet of things, they have substantially transformed the transportation landscape of human beings. In this paper we consider large-scale fleet management in ride-sharing companies that involve multiple units in different areas receiving sequences of products (or treatments) over time. Major technical challenges, such as policy evaluation, arise in those studies because (i) spatial and temporal proximities induce interference between locations and times; and (ii) the large number of locations results in the curse of dimensionality. To address both challenges simultaneously, we introduce a multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) framework for carrying policy evaluation in these studies. We propose novel estimators for mean outcomes under different products that are consistent despite the
translated_abstract: 两侧市场，如拼车公司，通常涉及一组主体在时间和/或位置上做出连续决策。随着智能手机和物联网的快速发展，它们已经大幅改变了人类的交通规划。本文考虑拼车公司的大规模车队管理，该管理涉及在不同区域接收经过时间处理的多个订单。这些研究面临着许多技术挑战，例如策略评估，因为(一)空间和时间的相似性会导致位置和时间之间的干扰；(二)众多的位置会导致维度诅咒。为了同时解决这两个挑战，我们提出了一个多智能体强化学习(MARL)框架，用于在这些研究中进行策略评估。
tldr: 本文提出了一个多智能体强化学习框架用于解决双边市场离线策略评估中的空间和时间干扰以及高维度问题。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a multi-agent reinforcement learning framework to tackle the spatial and temporal interference and high-dimensional problems in the off-policy evaluation of two-sided markets, such as ride-sharing companies.
